title: Highway 20 roundabout work begins Monday
maintext:
Construction will begin Monday on the Highway 20 roundabouts at Sharpes Corner and Miller/Gibralter roads.
Crews will start with the Miller/Gibraltar roads roundabout, according to a news release from the state Department of Transportation.
There, one lane of Highway 20 will be closed 24 hours a day while the roundabout is built. Crews will alternate traffic through the area.
It will take about one month to complete the roundabout, according to the release.
Near the end of construction on that roundabout, crews will begin construction on the Sharpes Corner roundabout.
Both roundabouts are expected to be completed by July 3.
